comps.name: Truesdail Laboratories
comps.description: Truesdail Laboratories, Inc. provides analytical and certification services. The company offers environmental testing services, including air analysis, toxic substance and pesticides, asbestos, solid waste, radiochemistry, and water quality and wastewater testing; microbiology services, which include bacteriological examinations, total coliform, steptococci, fungus resistance, aerobic plate counts, particle counts, and asbestos testing; and analytical chemistry services, which include flammability studies, coatings and paints, polymers and plastics, gas analysis, instrument and wet chemistry, and trace element analysis, as well as fuels, oils, and petrochemicals testing. It also provides product/specialty testing services, such as plumbing testing and listing, product certification, jewelry testing, and system component listings, as well as testing services for toys and products intended for children; veterinary testing services, including drug confirmation testing, pre-purchase drug testing, drug detection and identification, drug potency and purity, drug clearance, environmental analysis, drug contamination studies, and pharmaceutical assays; and Chrom VI, drinking water, hydraulic, hydrazine, and solid waste testing, as well as field services. The company was founded in 1931 and is based in Tustin, California.

comps.name: Comus Group
comps.description: Comus International is a manufacturer of tilt and tip-over switches, motion/vibration sensors, reed switches, reed relays, solid state relays, proximity sensors, float switches and a wide variety of custom turnkey sensors. The company has evolved into a world leader in the design, development and manufacture of a wide variety of sensors and sensor-related products. Applications are found in such diverse market segments as medical, automotive, white goods, alarm and security, and military/aerospace.

comps.name: Gibraltar Laboratories
comps.description: Gibraltar Laboratories, Inc. provides microbiology, virology, and analytical chemistry services for pharmaceutical, medical device, orthopedic, biopharmaceutical, biotech, nutraceutical, cosmetic, specialty chemical, and tissue bank industries. Its analytical chemistry services include compendial testing of raw material and drug products; forced degradation and stability studies; development and validation of test methods for testing of active drug substances and dosage forms; dissolution test method validation; plan and development of analytical cleaning; validation studies; method transfer; process validation; and residual solvents/volatile organic impurities. The company develops sterilization protocols and performs bioburden testing services, as well as provides a range of chemistry studies, including, qualification of APIs and raw materials, ETO residuals, residual solvents, ion chromatography, particulates, hemoglobin, and stability testing. In addition, it offers protocol development and validation testing for microbiological validations and chemical validations that include process validation, method development, validation, and transfer, as well as evaluation of vaccine/host systems for hemagglutination, inclusion bodies, mycoplasma, and adventitious viruses. Further, the company provides environmental monitoring services in pharmaceutical plants, including water, nitrogen, compressed air, and other gasses for particulate debris, hydrocarbons, airborne particulate matters, and contaminating microorganisms. Gibraltar Laboratories, Inc. was founded in 1970 and is based in Fairfield, New Jersey.

comps.name: WMT&R
comps.description: Westmoreland Mechanical Testing & Research, Inc. is an American research testing company for the medical, automotive, nuclear, and aerospace industries.

comps.name: Pulva Corporation
comps.description: Pulva Corporation was founded in 1988. The company's line of business includes the manufacturing of heavy machinery and equipment.

comps.name: GMW Associates
comps.description: GMW Associates is a sensor integration and distributions company developing products for on-contact, isolated sensing of mechanical position and magnetic material. It is based in San Carlos, CA.

comps.name: Exelon PowerLabs
comps.description: Exelon PowerLabs, LLC provides calibration of measuring and test equipment, and failure analysis and component testing services. The company offers electrical and physical measurement services, including equipment recommendations and application consultation; electrical, mechanical, and metallurgical equipment and component failure analysis; and recommendations for failure prevention, repairs, material selection, and root-cause analysis. It also offers radioactive component failure analysis and testing; overhead T&D component failure analysis and testing; electrical and electronic instrumentation failure analysis; EMI-RFI testing and performance analysis; commercial grade dedication and testing; component and product testing; fuels, lubricants, and transformer fluids and gasses testing services. The company was founded in 1911 and is based in Coatesville, Pennsylvania with facilities in Wilmington, Illinois; Plattsburgh, New York; and Madison Pennsylvania. Exelon PowerLabs, LLC operates as a subsidiary of Exelon Generation Company, LLC.

comps.name: E-Labs
comps.description: E-Labs is a Full-Service Testing Laboratory that evaluates the stability of products and technology. They work with industries such as aerospace, automotive, military, commercial, utility, electronics, and Information Technology entities to support testing needs.

comps.name: Quantum Design
comps.description: Quantum Design, Inc. develops, manufactures, and markets automated temperature and magnetic field testing platforms for materials characterization. Its products include a physical property measurement system (PPMS) for a range of magnetic, thermal, and electrical measurements; a magnetic property measurement system (MPMS) that is a high-sensitivity SQUID magnetometer for magnetic measurements; MPMS SQUID VSM that is a SQUID sensitivity combined with the vibrating sample magnetometer; portable and cryogen-free instruments that provide a suite of magnetic, thermal, and electrical measurements; and cryogen-free design solutions, which provide PPMS performance and measurements. The company also provides advanced technology liquefiers with helium recovery, storage, and purification systems to recover helium gas lost from normal boil off and helium transfers; scanning probe microscopes for the PPMS certified; high-performance and compact IR image furnaces; high pressure cell kits for the MPMS that allow sample insertion and removal without the need of an hydraulic press; and a line of DC SQUID sensors and electronics for custom applications. In addition, it offers sensitive and magnetic immunoassay systems for the detection of a range of biochemical analytes for use in medical, food safety, and environmental diagnostics; various scientific and industrial instrumentation solutions; and various technical support services. The company offers its automated materials characterization systems for research applications in the fields of physics, chemistry, materials science, nanotechnology, and biotechnology. It offers its products through its network of local direct offices around the world. The company was founded in 1982 and is based in San Diego, California.

comps.name: Jennmar
comps.description: Jennmar Corporation develops and manufactures ground control products for mining, tunneling, and civil construction industries. It offers primary roof/rib support and rock reinforcement products, such as bendable bolts, cable bolts, spring-loaded shells, combination bolt systems, conventional bolts, cuttable and corrosion resistant products, headed rebar bolts, bolt anchor systems, roof bolt re-tensioning systems, thread bars, tensioned rebar bolts, truss systems, and yielding rock bolts; and standing support products, which include impact resistant lagging steel structures, pumpable cement and containment bags, standard props, yieldable props, hydraulic props, overcasts, and rapid installation props. The company also provides surface/skin supports and accessories, including belt hangers, channels, mats, beams, meshes, galvanized and coated products, plates, and rail ties; resin and pumpable cement products, such as pumpable cribs, foaming cements, polyurethane resins, and polyurethane resin groutings; and engineering and fabrication services. Jennmar Corporation was formerly known as Frank Calandra, Inc. and changed its name to Jennmar Corporation in 1965. The company was founded in 1922 and is based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania with manufacturing plants in South Africa, Australia, Spain, China, Per, Chile, Mexico, Czech Republic, Poland, and the United States.
